etymologies: mid 19th century: from French, from titrer (see titrate)

definitions: the concentration of a solution as determined by titration.
shortDefinitions: concentration of solution as determined by titration

definitions: the minimum volume of a solution needed to reach the endpoint in a titration.
shortDefinitions: minimum volume of solution needed to reach end point in titration

definitions: the concentration of an antibody, as determined by finding the highest dilution at which it is still able to cause agglutination of the antigen.
shortDefinitions: concentration of antibody, as determined by finding highest dilution at which it is still able to cause agglutination of antigen
